messages.subject: Japanese Crest
messages.msgSnippet: I would think that a crest maker would be willing to make you one. I can get a Hanko with my family name on it, and hanko`s are used at banks etc--for official
messages.messageBody:
I would think that a crest maker would be willing to make you one.
I can get a Hanko with my family name on it, and hanko`s are used at banks etc--for official documents. A hanko is perhaps more important
than a crest--especially for official business.

Kev

--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Neil Brooks <brooksneil1@...> wrote:
>
> Hi
>
> I have a question that I am unable to get an answer to.
>
> How does a non-Japanese get a 'mon' family crest?
>
> Neil
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory]
messages.msgSnippet: Well-- you can always just make one up and pass it down to your kids.. etc.etc.    OR    You can marry a Japanese person and take on their family s
messages.messageBody:
Well-- you can always just make one up and pass it down to your kids.. etc.etc.
 
 OR
 
 You can marry a Japanese person and take on their family's crest..
 
 I mean.. those are really your only two options.
 
      

--- On Sat, 4/17/10, Neil Brooks <brooksneil1@...> wrote:


From: Neil Brooks <brooksneil1@...>
Subject: [samuraihistory]
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday, April 17, 2010, 8:04 AM


 



Hi

I have a question that I am unable to get an answer to.

How does a non-Japanese get a 'mon' family crest?

Neil
